newsitem.title: UK: History of the House of Windsor on CD-ROM.
newsitem.headline: History of the House of Windsor on CD-ROM.

text.p: For anyone who missed the press reports and magazine exclusives detailing the divorce of Britain's Prince Charles and Princess Diana, the gory details will be available soon on CD-ROM.
"Fourteen Weddings & A Divorce", will be in the shops in November, distributor VCI Software said on Wednesday.
VCI said the CD-ROM spelled out "the romantic and public history of the royal family in the 20th Century". Charles, the heir to the throne, and Diana finalised their divorce two weeks ago.
The CD-ROM charts the history, romances, affairs, weddings and tragedies of the House of Windsor with video clips, archive recordings, pictures and text.
"There is a phenomenal interest in the royal family in this country, the United States, Japan and the whole world," Julian Moore, VCI head of marketing, said.
"It is a populist approach but interesting also in a historical sense. We think it will be a big seller."
The CD-ROM will sell for 29.99 pounds ($46.64).
